name: Ru-Xin Wang
content: Ruxin Wang Search Ruxin (Daisy) Wang Assistant Professor Department of Computer Science at The University of Texas--San Antonio Biography I am a tenure-track Assistant Professor in Computer Science at the University of Texas--San Antonio. I earned my Ph.D degree in Computer Science from Southern Methodist University under the supervision of Dr. Chen Wang, and my Master’s degree in Engineering and Computer Science from Syracuse University. I lead the Cybersecurity, Privacy, and Healthcare Lab (CypherLab). My research interests include Cybersecurity and Privacy, Mobile and Ubiquitous Sensing, AR/MR, AI in Healthcare. CypherLab welcomes research intern students. Please contact me with your resume and use the subject line format: "Intern Application + Your Name." Interests Cybersecurity and Privacy Mobile and Ubiquitous Sensing Augmented and Mixed Reality (AR/MR) AI in Healthcare Education Ph.D in Computer Science, 2020 - 2025 Southern Methodist University, TX, USA M.S in Computer Engineering, 2017 - 2019 Syracuse University-Syracuse, NY, USA B.S in Electronic Engineering, 2013 - 2017 Northeast Forestry University, Harbin, China News [Jul 15, 2025] Our paper "DrinkMR: Unobtrusive Drinking Monitoring Using Off-The-Shelf Smart Glasses" is accepted at IEEE MASS25. [Jul 15, 2025] Our paper "Converting Your Bluetooth Headphones into Active Sensing Authenticator: a Bond-Conduction Solution" is accepted at IEEE MASS25. [Jun 23, 2025] I successfully defended my Ph.D. dissertation, with heartfelt thanks to my committee members! [Jun 06, 2025] Two of our collaborative works have been accepted by APHA25, congrats, Gabrielle! [Mar 30, 2025] I am excited to continue my academic career at the University of Texas--San Antonio as an Assistant Professor in Fall 2025. [Nov 14, 2024] Our poster "Unobtrusive Drinking Monitoring Using Off-The-Shelf AR Glasses" is presented in 2024 North Texas BME Symposium at UT Southwestern Medical Center. [Jun 03, 2024] I'm excited to share that I will be working as an AI Scientist Intern at Wyze this summer! [Apr 08, 2024] I'm named among the CPS Rising Stars in 2024. [Mar 23, 2024] Our paper "Enhancing QR Code System Security by Verifying the Scanner's Gripping Hand Biometric" is accepted at ACM WiSec24. [Mar 01, 2024] Our paper "Fast Detection of Handheld Phone-distracted Driving by Sensing the Driver's Hand-grip" is accepeted for publication in the IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology.
